data.event: The first post office at the site was known as Fish Point and opened in 1840.
The L&N reached the settlement in 1870 and named its station after James Livingston, a local landowner.
The post office was renamed Livingston Station in 1879 and, following the city's 1880 incorporation, Livingston in 1882.
On weekends, area residents gather to events downtown that celebrate their music and heritage.
